item.description:
While I have never run a Marathon, I have Biked in 20 Charity Bike Rides.  Aside from the Beautiful Sites, along the Ride, I always remember the Volunteers at the Rest Stops & those cheering at the Finish Line.  It appears, many of the Wounded, were the Spectators & Volunteers, whose cheering made all the Training worth while.  That is why I am dedicating this Ride to them & any Runners who were also Wounded.

 

The way I see it, we have 2 choices.  We can run & hide or we can stand-up and not let those responsible, take control of our lives.  Patriots,  do not run and hide.  Now about The Ride.

 

This is an all Speed Ride.  You can Ride  12-17  miles ( 1/2 Marathon) or you can ride 25-30 miles, a full Marathon.  The Route is Marked & I may have a Map.  It is very scenic & flat. Plenty of Water Views.  OK there is a Hill on the second half of the ride, just like Boston.    We have rode some sections, but at least 1/2 - 3/4 will be new.  There are a couple of sidetrack options,  that is why the mileage varies.

 

The first half is basically a loop, that ends at Narragansett Pier.  The second half, returns by the same Route.  Should you get tired on the second half,  you can cross the Road & head back.  I plan to Ride in the 12-13 mile per hour range. Maybe a little slower, depending on who is Riding.   Since the Route is marked, the faster Riders, can go at their own pace.

 

I am not sure what to wear as a tribute to the Wounded.  American Flag ??  Feel free to offer suggestions. Thanks

Directions:  95 South, Exit # 9- Route 4 South. ( this is a Left Lane Exit ),  Stay on Route 4, and it will become Route One South.  Stay on Route One & take the Route 108, Point Judith, Scarborough  Exit.  All three are on the Exit Sign.  Right at the end. Go thru 2 lights & the School is down about 1/2 Mile, on the Left, from the second light.
item.how_to_find_us: We are in the parking Lot, in Front of the School. I believe the Second Entrance.
